meanings.definition: A small, handheld weapon used for striking or hitting.
meanings.sent1: Tommy held the batlet tightly in his hand.
meanings.sent2: The detective found a batlet at the crime scene.
meanings.sent3: The toy batlet made the children giggle during playtime.
meanings.sent4: The batlet of sunlight broke through the clouds.
meanings.sent5: The shiny batlet gleamed in the moonlight.

meanings.definition: To engage in a physical fight or conflict.
meanings.sent1: The two friends decided to batlet playfully in the yard.
meanings.sent2: The rival teams will batlet for the championship title.
meanings.sent3: The siblings always batlet over who gets the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: The politicians will batlet fiercely for votes in the election.
meanings.sent5: The warriors prepared to batlet bravely on the battlefield.

meanings.definition: A small, winged mammal capable of sustained flight.
meanings.sent1: The batlet swooped gracefully through the night sky.
meanings.sent2: A colony of batlets roosted in the old cave.
meanings.sent3: The tiny batlet got tangled in the curtains and caused a commotion.
meanings.sent4: The batlet's wings fluttered like delicate black silk.
meanings.sent5: The elusive batlet darted between the trees with precision.
